While it's not great to see mages shove supports out of bot lane, I think that's only part of the problem: one issue is that mages are becoming more popular duo laners than members of a class explicitly designed to assist other players, but another issue alongside that is that **supports have nowhere else to go.** Unlike literally every other class in the game, most supports cannot successfully migrate to a solo lane or the jungle, so if they can't go bot, they can't go anywhere at all. 

This is one of the many reasons why supports need another update, as support balance is so isolated and bizzarely tuned relative to every other position that it both limits supports' ability to function properly in other positions, and repeatedly generates balance issues when champions switch over to or from the support position. Malzahar and Brand are examples of champions who are exceedingly strong in bot lane, despite being okay to underwhelming in mid lane, and before that there was the case of support Annie and Fiddlesticks in Season 4, both of whom had to receive balance changes due to their bot lane shenanigans. On the flipside, we also have Lulu, who's suffered tremendously for her presence in top lane, and beyond that there are many more champions who could almost be viable in another role, namely Taric top, Leona jungle, Blitzcrank in both those positions (he used to be a good top/jungle fighter in Seasons 2-3), etc., but who aren't because support balance prevents them from going anywhere else.

Connecting the support class more to the rest of balance should prevent abuse cases like Brand and Malzahar from happening as severely, but if nothing else it should give supports a place to go if they ever get shoved out of bot lane. In fact, it might be useful as a general rule to give every champion at least two positions they can thrive in, so that they can never be completely pushed out of the game by competing picks.
